questions.question: A European patent was granted to a German company on 4  January 2023. No opposition was filed. Mr Li and Ms Smith were designated as inventors. On 12 October 2023,  the patent proprietor not ices that Ms Smith was erroneously designated as inventor and that Mr Li is the sole inventor.  Which of the following statements is correct?
options: A. Ms Smith will be deleted as inventor if the patent proprietor requests this in writing .
B. Ms Smith can no longer  be deleted as inventor because no proceedings are pending before the EPO .
C. The patent proprietor can request that  Ms Smith be deleted as inventor but needs Mr Li 's consent  for this .
D. Ms Smith can only be deleted as inventor with her consent .

questions.question: On 10 October 2021, European patent attorney X filed European patent application EP -A with the EPO on the applicant's behalf. Application EP -A was published on 12 April 2023, together  with the extended European search report. On 6  October 2023, the applicant contacts a new European patent attorney  Y to replace X as representative and issues Y with its instructions to reply to the extended European search report. The applicant did not inform X that he would be replaced.  What are the steps necessary to validly appoint representative Y and to avoid any loss of rights for European patent application EP -A?
options: A. New representative Y requests a change of representative, files a response to the extended European search report with the EPO by 12 October 2023 at the latest and files in good time an authorisation signed by the applicant .
B. New representative Y requests a change of representative and files a response to the extended European search report with  the EPO by 12 October 2023 at the latest .
C. New representative Y requests a change of representative and files a response to the extended European search report with the EPO by 23 October 2023 at the latest.

D. New representative Y requests a change of representative, files a response to the extended European search report with the EPO by 23 October 2023 at the latest and files in good time an authorisation signed by the applicant .

questions.question: Last week Greta validly filed the international patent application PCT -G with the German Patent and Trade mark Office ( DPMA ) and appointed Hassan to represent her. Hassan is entitled to act before the DPMA  but he is not a European patent attorney. Greta and Hassan are resident in Germany.  Which of the following statements is not correct?
options: A. Hassan can represent Greta before the EPO acting as the International Searching Authority for PCT -G.
B. In order for Hassan to be able to act before the EPO acting as the International Searching Authority , he needs to submit a power of attorney signed by Greta.
C. According to the provisions of the PCT, it is mandatory that the d emand for international preliminary examination is signed by Greta or Hassan.
D. According to the provisions of the PCT, an international application can only be withdrawn by the applicant or an agent appointed by a power of attorney.

questions.question: In which of the following cases is the applicant entitled to a reduction of the filing fee  under Rule  6 EPC ? A declaration of such entitlement has  been made by crossing the relevant box on Form  1001.
options: A. A Spanish European patent attorney files a European patent application in Spanish for a natural person who is resident in Andorra and of Andorra n nationality .

questions.question: Mr Van Holland is a Dutch citizen resident in the Netherlands. He filed a European patent application EP -parent in Dutch, together with  a translation into English. Whil e EP-parent was pending, Mr Van Holland filed a divisional application EP -div in Dutch and requested examination in Dutch. He paid all fees due for EP -div. He has not filed an English translation of EP -div. The Receiving Section has now issued a noting of l oss of rights.  Which of the following statements is correct?
options: A. The deficiency cannot be remedied.
B. Mr Van Holland can remedy the deficiency by filing an English translation of EP -div within two months of notification of the communication  under Rule 112(1) EPC .
C. Mr Van Holland needs to file an English translation of EP -div together with a request for f urther processing.

Today, 12  October 2023, you receive a communication from the EPO entitled " Decision to grant a European patent pursuant to Article  97(1) EPC ". options: A. The renewal fee for the fourth year must be paid centrally to the EPO. The due date is 16 November 2023.
B. The renewal fee for the fourth year must be paid centrally to the EPO. The due date is 30 November 2023.

C. The renewal fee for the fourth year must be paid separately in each state where the patent is validated. The renewal fee for the fourth year can be validly paid without any additional fee until 9 January 2024 at the latest .

questions.question: During oral proceedings, the opposition division decided to maintain the patent in amended form on the basis of a request in which the description contains a paragraph with handwritten amendments.  Which of the following statements is correct ?
options: A. Upon request the patent proprietor must  pay the fee for publishing a new specification, file translations of the claims and file a formally compliant version of the entire description.

B. If a party files an appeal, the patent proprietor will not be invited to pay the fee for publishing a new specification, file translations of the claims or file a formally compliant version of the amended paragraph  while the appeal proceedings are still pending.

C. Together with the interlocutory decision, the patent proprietor will receive an invitation to pay the fee for publishing a new specification, file translations of the claims and file a formally compliant version of the amended paragraph.

D. If no appeal is filed, the patent proprietor must, upon request, pay the fee for publishing a new specification, file translations of the claims and file a typed version of the amended paragraph within four months.

questions.question: A European patent application was filed on 20 March 2020. Proceedings were interrupted under  Rule 142 EPC on 10  March 2022. The applicant was informed that proceedings would be resumed today, 12 October 2023. No renewal fee has been paid so far . Which of the following statements is correct?
options: A. As no renewal fees have been paid, the application is deemed to be withdrawn .
B. The renewal fees for the third and fourth years can be validly paid without any additional fee on 12 October 2023 at the latest .
C. The renewal fees for the third and fourth years can be validly paid with an additional  fee by 30  April 2024 at the latest .
D. The renewal fees for the third and fourth years can be validly paid without any additional fee by 31  October 2023 at the latest .

The time limit for filing an application within the priority period can be remedied by requesting re-establishment of rights under Article 122(1). This is because re-establishment of rights is available when an applicant, despite taking all due care required by the circumstances, was unable to observe a time limit vis-à-vis the EPO. Filing within the priority period is critical for maintaining the claim to priority and thus falls under the scope where such a request can be made.

According to Rule 51(1), the renewal fee for each year of a European patent application is due by the end of the month containing the anniversary of the date of filing. For EP-A filed on November 16, 2020, the fourth-year renewal fee would be due by the last day in November 2023 (i.e., November 30, 2023). After a patent is granted and validated in specific contracting states, the payment of subsequent annual fees must be made to those national offices. The decision to grant was issued on October 12, 2023. According to Rule 51(4), renewal fees due within four months from that date (i.e., until February 9, 2024) can still be paid without an additional fee. Hence, the fourth-year renewal fee must be paid separately in each state where validation occurs and it can be validly paid without any additional fee up to January 9, 2024. Based on the information provided in the Guidelines for Examination in the EPO and Euro-PCT Guide, if an applicant has filed amendments under Article 19 PCT during the international phase (after receipt of a negative written opinion from the ISA/EPO), but no request for international preliminary examination was made, the application will enter the European regional phase with those amendments. Given that no further amendments were filed upon entry into the regional phase using Form 1200 and no IPER (International Preliminary Examination Report) was prepared, Rule 161(2) applies. \nRule 161(2) allows for a communication to be issued under Rules 161/162 that offers an opportunity to file amendments before the application is taken forward. In this scenario, Form 1226BB would be sent out as it offers the applicant the chance to comment and potentially amend the application documents.\nForm 1226AA (Option A) typically indicates a more severe situation where failure to respond results in withdrawal of the application; this does not apply here since no specific time-sensitive deadline for amendments is mentioned beyond offering an opportunity. Form 1226CC (Option C) would be issued if there was a need for supplementary European search, but the text specifies that amendments under Rule 161(2) are being considered first. This suggests a preliminary step before any further examination or supplementary search steps. \nForm 1226AC (Option D) indicates the start of substantive examination, which does not apply here since the application is still in an amendment and preparation stage prior to any formal examination proceedings.\nIn conclusion, the correct form issued under these circumstances is Form 1226BB, offering the opportunity to comment and file amendments. Therefore, option B is the correct answer.

According to R. 126(2) EPC, if a document is delivered by postal services and arrives within seven days after the date it bears (registered letter), it shall be deemed delivered on that date. Therefore, according to R. 126(2) EPC, a period for which the deemed receipt of that document is the relevant event under R. 131 shall be extended by two days (9-7=2), resulting in a new deadline of 12 January 2025.

The EPO Contingency Upload Service is recommended for use when there is a system outage at the EPO that prevents document submission via the standard filing systems. This can be inferred from the provided texts, particularly where it states that certain documents are excluded from being filed by fax or using the EPO web-form filing service but mentions the contingency upload service in relation to handling situations that require alternative means of submission. Option A is incorrect because there is no mention of the Contingency Upload Service for use outside regular business hours. The standard processes and systems should be sufficient during normal operations, including after-hours submissions through other electronic methods. Option B is incorrect as well. If only a technical issue at your end arises while the EPO filing systems are functioning correctly, you would typically resolve or work around that issue without needing to use the Contingency Upload Service, which implies broader system failure rather than individual user issues. Option D is also incorrect because official holidays should not require special document submission methods. The regular processes and allowances for late submissions due to public holidays or non-working days are already established by EPO rules and do not necessitate using a contingency service specifically for such situations.
